It's such a shame that this is the only game left standing in this genre, because the devs have been taking it down the worst route possible. This used to be such a great game, but two years of ignoring optimization and matchmaking, forgetting how to make good killers and not knowing how to balance an asymmetric game has ruined it, I fear it may be beyond repair.

They had statistics that showed that a certain perk, Hex: Ruin was by far the most used at high ranks, because it was the most powerful tool killers had to slow down the game, without it, the game would breeze by way too quickly and killers would have no chance. So what did they decide to do about this?

They didn't slow the game down in any way.

They didn't give killers some other tool to slow the game down.

What they did was nerf Hex: Ruin into the ground.

They're balancing the game around the lowest ranks, once a new player starts to become adept at the game, they begin to see all the glaring issues and leave. They're encouraging low-skill play by removing all the tools needed to enable high-skill play.

Give it a whirl if you must, just know that it'll fall apart fast.

[h1]This is a review after the 3.5.0 Patch update.[/h1]

Before this patch, BHVR announced micro-transactions in the form of the Rift which would act as a Battle Pass as seen on a game like Fortnite. But unlike Fortnite, the grind to achieve tiers is slow and arduous. The prizes to be earned are laughable/not aesthetically nice looking and few. And there is no return for the money invested other than the 10$ originally invested as a return when you make it to the 70th tier. Keep in mind, this is a game you pay 20$ for and then invest in their DLC for about 7$ (there are 22 DLC's in total with a few ranging in a lower price + 1 that is higher). So not only is this a game you pay for to play but they also want you to invest more money in a mediocre tier system that is a ridiculous grind in hope that you just say "screw it" and pay for the tiers you want.

The amount of games you'd have to play is akin to working a job. I see streamers have no trouble with the rift because they do play this game for up to 8+ hrs at a time. But for casual folks or those who try to get in 3 hrs a night like myself, it's a noticeable soul-crushing grind. Why are they hoarding points from players? Why do Challenges not actually affect the Tier progression? But notice- you can BUY a tier for 1$ with their in-game currency if you REALLY want those wonderful designs the community-made at the end of year 3 :) I don't even wanna talk about the Lore and Archives because honestly, it's just a lot of weird retcon and/or continuity errors for characters who are relatively new to the DBD Roster. The game has come to feel like an irrefutable cash grab.

I paid for the game and (almost) all the DLC offered, and honestly the games constant jittering with servers, and glitches/bugs have just not made it enjoyable. I loved this game when I first started playing and now it's just exhausting. If there's one thing Survivor and Killer mains can agree on, it's that this game makes players feel so tired and drained after a few matches.

Настало время написать обзор про игру, которая раньше безумно нравилась и помогала скрасить скучные дни.
С каждым обновлением игра становится всё хуже и хуже. 
Последнее обновление - убийство игры за пеших маньяков. Их просто отправили пылиться на полку. 
Теперь группа выживших будет чинить все генераторы за 3 минуты и приседать на выходе, назвав при этом полным нубом и дауном. Токсичные игроки, играющие в группе и выигрывающие низкие ранги, - ещё одна проблема игры.
Матчмейкинг стал просто ужасным: на 15 ранге тебе могут попасться выжившие 1-4. 
Разработчики окончательно превратили самобытную игру в помойку, в которую даже играть не хочется.
Своими бездарными действиями и откровенным наплевательским отношением к сообществу убили онлайн, который в перспективе будет только снижаться.
Зато каждую неделю стабильно выпускают костюмчики.
Года 1.5 назад поставил бы игре 10/10, сейчас ставлю 0.
Очень нравиться

The state of the game is near unplayable, but not in a buggy broken way.
Both survivors and killers have absolutely broken perks and if you're not sweating your balls off on either side you're gonna get either 4k'd or 4 Escaped.
Theres a survivor meta where one survivor chases and another body block, break hooks, and heal eachother, literally taking away every killer's main function/objective, while the other does gens as they please. You can have all 4 survivors down on the ground at a point and still get 4e' d.
And on the killer side bird lady is kinda dumb. It's super easy to shut down small loops by just putting down a bird and either forcing them to run off of it or take a hit.
We could recommend all the changed we want but nothing will change for the better. I have tons of ideas, as do so many other smart and creative people, dbd pros and content creators alike, but BHVR just never listens, and I dont think they ever will.
The community is one of the most toxic. Ubisoft levels of game exploits and slurs. I still hop on every now and then but I never binge like I used to.

TLDR; This game isnt worth it.

Oh boy... how to rate this... Well, it's a good game, but you're gonna be gimped without certain perks, and some of the best in the game are locked behind DLC. You'll be fine playing survivor if you have Bill from L4D, but playing killer can be really tough sometimes, especially with how long the queue times take. 

Also, something important to know; a good killer will get you, no matter how awesome your skills at juking. They're faster than you, and there's no skill in the game that stuns them long enough to just get away scot free. The best thing you can do is try to prolong the chase as long as possible, and to start checking what perks they're using after the game ends so that you start developing techniques to deal with those.

Love this game, i am far from good at it, but that doesnt change the fact i like it, it got good graphics, pretty unique gameplay, you can play with your friends or you can go solo. likein every other pvp game you will hear whining about this and that from both sides killers/survivors equally. in generall its a good game to have a lot of fun with. is it baalnced? no... depending on the active patch it swing in either direction. but with a gameplay design liek this to balance it perfectly is nearly impossible. so i go with, is it fun for either side to play? and yes, if you dont run in someone salty (rarely) you can have a hell of a time in this game.
